title: Welcome to KIN 479: Motor Control
text: Welcome to KIN 479: Motor Control! This course examines foundational and applied aspects of human motor control through an integrated approach to movement across the lifespan. We will explore how the nervous system controls movement, from basic reflexes to complex motor skills.

title: Welcome to KIN 479: Motor Control
text: Welcome to KIN 479: Motor Control! This course examines foundational and applied aspects of human motor control through an integrated approach to movement across the lifespan. We will explore how the nervous system controls movement, from basic reflexes to complex motor skills.

title: Welcome to KIN 479: Motor Control
text:
Course Overview
This course covers:

Foundational knowledge in motor control
Sensory and motor physiology
Motor control theories and their applications
Rehabilitation and clinical practice applications
Current research in motor control

title: Welcome to KIN 479: Motor Control
text:
Course Overview
This course examines foundational and applied aspects of human motor control through an integrated approach to movement across the lifespan.


Focus on perception-action loop
Links between sensation, cognition, and movement
Applications to rehabilitation and clinical practice
Engagement with current research

title: Welcome to KIN 479: Motor Control
text:
Learning Objectives
By the end of this course, you will be able to:


Describe approaches to understanding motor control
Apply knowledge of sensorimotor structures
Explain theories of motor control
Design evidence-based exercises
Critique current motor control research
Reflect on historical evolution of motor control theories

title: Welcome to KIN 479: Motor Control
text:
Course Format



Structure

Fully online and asynchronous
Materials posted Mondays by 5:00 PM
Weekly assignments due following Monday




Materials

Required Textbook: Rosenbaum’s “Human Motor Control” (2nd Ed.)
Canvas for assignments and communication
Weekly readings and quizzes

title: Welcome to KIN 479: Motor Control
text:
Group Project Overview
This course includes a major group project where you’ll investigate a movement disorder:


Work in assigned groups (check Canvas > People > Groups)
Develop expertise in a specific movement disorder
Create and record a professional presentation
Engage with peer presentations and provide feedback


View complete presentation guidelines

title: Welcome to KIN 479: Motor Control
text:
Movement Disorders
Choose from disorders such as:



Parkinson’s disease
Cerebral palsy
Multiple sclerosis
Huntington’s disease



Essential tremor
Ataxia
ALS
Tourette’s syndrome



Important Dates:

Topic submission: Feb 10 @ 5pm
Video presentation: April 14 @ 5pm
Peer evaluation: May 13 @ 5pm

See course syllabus for complete schedule and policies.

title: Welcome to KIN 479: Motor Control
text:
Presentation Requirements



Format

15-minute video presentation
Include slides and speakers
Professional delivery
Minimum 7 peer-reviewed references




Content

Neurophysiology
Skill performance
Treatment approaches
Overall outlook
